docs.text: Document objective assessment findings, interventions performed, resident response, provider notification, orders received, and family/EC notification when applicable. Compare findings to baseline and note any change.

docs.title: 42 CFR Part 483 – Requirements for States and Long Term Care Facilities (eCFR)
docs.heading: Resident rights: refusal and informed decision-making
docs.text: Federal regulations include resident rights related to informed choices about care, including the right to refuse treatment. Documentation should reflect the resident’s stated refusal, education provided, risks/benefits discussed, alternatives offered, and follow-up plan.

docs.title: 42 CFR Part 483 – Requirements for States and Long Term Care Facilities (eCFR)
docs.heading: Quality of care: change in condition response
docs.text: When a resident’s condition changes, nursing assessment, timely notification, and appropriate interventions/monitoring are expected. Record objective findings, baseline comparison, provider notification, orders, and resident response.

docs.title: 42 CFR Part 483 – Requirements for States and Long Term Care Facilities (eCFR)
docs.heading: Accidents and supervision (falls risk)
docs.text: Facilities must take reasonable steps to prevent accidents and provide adequate supervision/assistive devices. Post-fall documentation should include circumstances, injury assessment, neuro checks if indicated, notifications, and prevention plan updates.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance to Surveyors)
docs.heading: F-tag mapping: use citations in packets
docs.text: Appendix PP provides interpretive guidance used by surveyors. When generating packets, include the relevant F-tag context (e.g., Resident Rights, Abuse/Neglect, Infection Control) and tie your actions/documentation to objective evidence and facility policy.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance to Surveyors)
docs.heading: Abuse/neglect: immediate protection + reporting + investigation
docs.text: Survey expectations emphasize immediate resident protection, timely reporting, thorough investigation, and documentation of findings and follow-up. Notes should include who was notified, when, what protections were implemented, and the investigation status.

docs.title: CMS State Operations Manual Appendix PP (LTC Guidance to Surveyors)
docs.heading: Infection control: program expectations
docs.text: Survey guidance on infection control focuses on an active program, implementation of precautions, staff education, and documentation that supports decisions (signs/symptoms, testing, isolation, monitoring).

docs.title: CDC/HICPAC Core Infection Prevention and Control Practices (PDF)
docs.heading: Core practices: hand hygiene + PPE selection
docs.text: Core IPC practices include consistent hand hygiene and selecting PPE based on anticipated exposure. Documentation and audits should focus on adherence to core practices and staff education/competency.

docs.title: CDC/HICPAC Core Infection Prevention and Control Practices (PDF)
docs.heading: Core practices: environmental cleaning and disinfection
docs.text: Environmental cleaning and disinfection are key core practices. For outbreaks, emphasize high-touch surfaces, correct disinfectant use, and clear assignment of responsibilities.

docs.title: CDC/HICPAC Core Infection Prevention and Control Practices (PDF)
docs.heading: Core practices: respiratory hygiene/cough etiquette
docs.text: Respiratory hygiene and cough etiquette reduce transmission of respiratory pathogens. For symptomatic residents, include source control, masking per guidance, and timely evaluation/testing as indicated.

docs.title: CDC Infection Prevention and Long-term Care Facility Residents (LTCFs)
docs.heading: LTCF infection prevention: resident/family education
docs.text: CDC LTCF resources support education for residents, families, and caregivers on preventing infections in nursing homes and assisted living facilities. Use these materials to reinforce hand hygiene, vaccination, and reporting symptoms early.

docs.title: CDC Infection Prevention and Long-term Care Facility Residents (LTCFs)
docs.heading: LTCF prevention focus: early symptom recognition
docs.text: Emphasize early recognition of new symptoms and prompt reporting to nursing staff to reduce spread and complications. Pair with facility policy for triage and provider notification.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component
docs.heading: NHSN LTCF Component: surveillance and process measures
docs.text: NHSN LTCF Component supports tracking infections and prevention process measures to identify problems, improve care, and monitor progress. Consider aligning facility line lists and surveillance logs with NHSN concepts.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component
docs.heading: Common LTCF modules: UTI, MDRO/CDI, vaccination
docs.text: NHSN LTCF includes modules relevant to nursing homes (e.g., UTI, MDRO/CDI, HCP flu vaccination, prevention process measures). Use these as a reference framework for consistent surveillance documentation.

docs.title: CDC Viral Respiratory Pathogens Toolkit for Nursing Homes
docs.heading: Respiratory viruses: prepare and respond in nursing homes
docs.text: Toolkit actions include preparation steps, symptom-based response, testing considerations, and escalation when respiratory illness is detected among residents or staff. Use for influenza/RSV/COVID-19 season planning and outbreak response.

docs.title: CDC Viral Respiratory Pathogens Toolkit for Nursing Homes
docs.heading: Outbreak workflow: line lists and communication
docs.text: Maintain clear line lists, communicate with leadership and public health as required, and document cohorting/precautions decisions. Ensure staff education and consistent PPE use.

docs.title: IHI SBAR Tool (Situation–Background–Assessment–Recommendation)
docs.heading: SBAR structure for provider notification
docs.text: SBAR provides a structured way to communicate changes in condition: Situation (what is happening now), Background (baseline and history), Assessment (your findings), Recommendation (what you need/next steps). Use SBAR in notes to show clear escalation.

docs.title: IHI SBAR Tool (Situation–Background–Assessment–Recommendation)
docs.heading: SBAR documentation cues for LTC/SNF notes
docs.text: In documentation, capture: objective findings (VS, symptoms, timeline), baseline comparison, what was communicated to provider, orders received, interventions performed, and resident response/monitoring plan.

docs.title: AHRQ Long-Term Care: Communicating Change in a Resident’s Condition (Tools)
docs.heading: Change in condition communication: early warning tools
docs.text: AHRQ LTC tools include early warning/communication supports to help staff recognize and communicate changes in condition. Integrate into your wizard by prompting for objective findings and clear escalation steps.

docs.title: AHRQ Long-Term Care: Communicating Change in a Resident’s Condition (Tools)
docs.heading: Team communication training: standardize the message
docs.text: Use standardized communication (e.g., SBAR) and team training to reduce missed information during a change in condition. Pair with documentation checklists and packet citations.

docs.title: CMS Nursing Home QAPI Resources (includes INTERACT II link)
docs.heading: QAPI: link findings to education and re-audit
docs.text: CMS QAPI resources emphasize systematic improvement: identify a problem, implement interventions (including staff education), measure outcomes, and sustain changes. Use this to power closed-loop QA → Education → Re-audit workflows.

docs.title: CMS QAPI at a Glance (PDF)
docs.heading: QAPI governance: leadership and accountability
docs.text: QAPI at a Glance highlights leadership responsibility, data-driven improvement, and ongoing performance monitoring. Use this as an executive-language reference in survey packets and QAPI minutes.

docs.title: NYSDOH: Your Rights as a Nursing Home Resident in New York State (PDF)
docs.heading: NY nursing home resident rights: key themes
docs.text: NYSDOH resident rights resources emphasize dignity, respect, communication, and participation in care decisions. Documentation should reflect education provided, resident preferences, and involvement of representative when appropriate.

docs.title: 10 NYCRR 415.3 – Residents’ Rights (New York)
docs.heading: NYCRR 415.3: resident rights baseline
docs.text: 10 NYCRR 415.3 describes nursing home responsibilities to protect and promote resident rights, including dignity, privacy, and self-determination. Use when building refusal-of-treatment packets and documenting resident-centered decision-making.

docs.title: NYSDOH: Patient Abuse Reporting Requirements (Nursing Homes/Hospitals)
docs.heading: NY reporting expectations: suspected abuse/neglect
docs.text: NYSDOH outlines reporting requirements for suspected abuse, mistreatment, and neglect. Documentation should include immediate protections, notifications, and the status of investigation/reporting per policy.

docs.title: NYSDOH: Nursing Home Resident Abuse & Complaint Investigation Report (PDF)
docs.heading: NY investigation report: what to include
docs.text: The NYSDOH incident/abuse reporting materials support consistent investigation reporting. For packets, include objective findings, timeline, actions taken, notifications, and follow-up/monitoring.

docs.title: NYSDOH Nursing Home Complaint Form (Online)
docs.heading: NY complaint process: resident/family pathway
docs.text: NYSDOH provides an online complaint form and hotline information. Include this reference in resident rights packets when concerns escalate beyond facility grievance processes.

docs.title: CMS QSO-25-14-NH – Revised LTC Surveyor Guidance (Appendix PP updates)
docs.heading: What this memo changes (high level)
docs.text: CMS issued QSO-25-14-NH to revise long-term care surveyor guidance. Use this memo as the “why” behind Appendix PP updates and align facility education, audits, and packets with the updated expectations.

docs.title: CMS QSO-25-14-NH – Revised LTC Surveyor Guidance (Appendix PP updates)
docs.heading: Effective date and rollout
docs.text: Treat the updated surveyor guidance as effective on the stated CMS rollout date; ensure staff education, competency checks, and audit tools reflect the revised interpretive guidance and critical element pathways.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component Manual
docs.heading: Why NHSN LTCF tracking matters
docs.text: Use NHSN LTCF component concepts to standardize infection tracking and prevention measures. A consistent surveillance approach supports outbreak detection, QAPI trending, and documentation that is easy to defend.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component Manual
docs.heading: Line list discipline
docs.text: Maintain a clean line list during clusters/outbreaks: who, what symptoms, onset dates, test results, unit/room, isolation status, and outcomes. Keep it current and use it for escalation and reporting.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Antibiotic stewardship in nursing homes (program focus)
docs.text: Use a nursing-home-specific antimicrobial stewardship framework: define criteria for suspected infection, improve communication (SBAR), and monitor antibiotic starts, indications, and durations as part of QAPI.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Documentation cues for suspected infection
docs.text: When antibiotics are considered, document the suspected source, objective signs/symptoms, relevant vitals, test plan, and monitoring/escalation plan. Avoid vague “UTI” language without clinical criteria.

docs.title: IDSA Clinical Practice Guideline – Asymptomatic Bacteriuria
docs.heading: Do not treat asymptomatic bacteriuria (LTC)
docs.text: In older residents in long-term care, bacteriuria without symptoms is common. Use clinical criteria before treating; do not screen or treat asymptomatic bacteriuria unless specific exceptions apply (follow provider/facility protocol).

docs.title: IDSA Clinical Practice Guideline – Complicated Urinary Tract Infections (cUTI)
docs.heading: When UTI is complicated
docs.text: Use provider guidance and clinical criteria to distinguish uncomplicated lower urinary symptoms from complicated UTI (e.g., obstruction, systemic illness, instrumentation). Document reason for concern and escalation plan.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Core elements of infection prevention in LTC
docs.text: A strong LTC infection prevention program includes surveillance, outbreak response, staff education, hand hygiene/PPE, environmental cleaning, and reporting to public health when required. Tie infection control work to QAPI.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Notifiable disease reporting expectations
docs.text: Maintain a system to recognize and report notifiable diseases to public health. Document who was notified, when, and what data were provided (line list, labs, case counts).

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Purpose and scope
docs.text: Use a structured antimicrobial stewardship program in nursing homes to improve antibiotic use, reduce harms, and support appropriate diagnosis and treatment decisions.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: When to suspect infection vs colonization
docs.text: Focus on resident-specific signs/symptoms and avoid treating colonization; document objective findings and clinical rationale for starting or withholding antibiotics.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Start, monitor, and maintain
docs.text: Establish facility goals, track antibiotic starts, review cultures and durations, and provide feedback/education to prescribers and staff.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Documentation essentials
docs.text: Document indication, symptoms, tests obtained, prescriber notification, orders, start date, planned duration, monitoring plan, and resident response.

docs.title: AHRQ Nursing Home Antimicrobial Stewardship Guide
docs.heading: Tools and templates
docs.text: Use standardized forms/checklists (e.g., SBAR, stop-and-watch, antibiotic time-outs) to ensure consistent communication and decision support.

docs.title: CDC Viral Respiratory Pathogens Toolkit for Nursing Homes
docs.heading: Early recognition and response
docs.text: When respiratory symptoms are identified, implement a structured response: assess, consider testing per guidance, and apply appropriate source control and precautions.

docs.title: CDC Viral Respiratory Pathogens Toolkit for Nursing Homes
docs.heading: Cohorting and precautions
docs.text: Use appropriate precautions (standard + transmission-based as indicated), consider cohorting residents/units, and reinforce PPE/hand hygiene.

docs.title: CDC Viral Respiratory Pathogens Toolkit for Nursing Homes
docs.heading: Outbreak communication
docs.text: Maintain line lists as needed, communicate with leadership and public health per policy, and document education and monitoring.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component Manual
docs.heading: What NHSN LTCF tracks
docs.text: Use the NHSN LTCF Component to track infections and prevention process measures over time to identify trends and improve care.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component Manual
docs.heading: UTI and MDRO surveillance concepts
docs.text: Standardize definitions and reporting approaches for events like UTI and MDRO/CDI to support consistent surveillance and benchmarking.

docs.title: CDC NHSN Long-term Care Facility (LTCF) Component Manual
docs.heading: Process measures
docs.text: Use process measures (e.g., hand hygiene, PPE, vaccination, prevention bundles) to drive improvement work alongside outcome measures.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Infection prevention program elements
docs.text: Maintain an organized infection prevention program with surveillance, education, policy oversight, and outbreak response capability.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Hand hygiene and PPE fundamentals
docs.text: Reinforce hand hygiene and PPE selection based on risk assessment; use audits and feedback to improve compliance.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Outbreak detection and response
docs.text: Establish triggers for outbreak detection, initiate control measures promptly, and coordinate reporting to public health when required.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Employee health considerations
docs.text: Include staff illness reporting and work restriction guidance, vaccination programs, and exposure management as part of infection prevention.

docs.title: SHEA/APIC Guideline – Infection Prevention and Control in the Long-Term Care Facility
docs.heading: Integration with QAPI
docs.text: Align infection prevention work with QAPI: track data, prioritize improvement projects, and document interventions and outcomes.

docs.title: IDSA Clinical Practice Guideline – Asymptomatic Bacteriuria
docs.heading: Avoid treating ASB in LTC residents
docs.text: In older residents of long-term care facilities, avoid screening for or treating asymptomatic bacteriuria; focus evaluation on symptoms and objective findings.

docs.title: IDSA Clinical Practice Guideline – Asymptomatic Bacteriuria
docs.heading: Documentation tip
docs.text: Document presence/absence of urinary symptoms and objective findings; if no symptoms, document rationale for not treating and monitoring plan.

docs.title: CMS QSO-25-14-NH – Revised LTC Surveyor Guidance (Appendix PP updates)
docs.heading: Effective date awareness
docs.text: Appendix PP revisions take effect on the stated CMS effective date; facilities should align training, audits, and policies accordingly.

docs.title: CMS QSO-25-14-NH – Revised LTC Surveyor Guidance (Appendix PP updates)
docs.heading: Training and readiness
docs.text: Prepare staff and leadership by reviewing revised pathways and guidance, updating facility processes, and ensuring documentation supports compliance.
